title: The Product is 2016, But Minimize the Sum
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The product of three natural numbers is equal to 2016. What's the least possible value for their sum?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You can even use AM GM inequality."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{a+b+c}{3}≥\sqrt[3]{abc}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that abc=2016,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c≥3 \times \sqrt[3]{2016}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
=>"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c≥3 \times 12.633"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For minimum value, 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c=3 \times 12.633
=>a+b+c=37.899
≈\boxed{38}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            This proves that no sum less than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"38"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is possible, but this fact alone does not give the answer.  We still need to factorize "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and discover that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(12, 12, 14)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a solution to conclude that the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"38"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016=4×504=4×4×126=4×4×14×9=
4×4×14×3×3=12×12×14. To see the sum minimum the nubers must be as close as possible to each other. So 12+12+14=38."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Give the last three digits of the sum of cubes of the first 2016 natural numbers."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of the cubes of the first n numbers: (n(n+1)/2)^2 
Plug in 2016 we obtain, 2033136^2 
Under modulo 1000
(2033136^2)mod1000=== 136^2mod1000= 496mod1000"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016^n+\underbrace{2016^2+2016^2+\ldots+2016^2}_{p\text{ times}}=2016^3\\
2016^n+p(2016^2)=2016^3\\
p(2016^2)=2016^3-2016^n\\
p=\dfrac{2016^3-2016^n}{2016^2}\\
p=2016-2016^{n-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is positive, we know that"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016-2016^{n-2}>0\\
2016^1>2016^{n-2}\\
1>n-2\\
n<3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an integer, we know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2016^{n-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be an integer. This implies that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n-2 \geq 0\\
n \geq 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Combine the two conditions, we have"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 \leq n < 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For this range of values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", there is only one integer value that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can take, and that is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=\boxed{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
